item.title: Lisa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Lisa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Do not meddle in the affairs of wizards, for they are subtle and quick to anger." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Lisa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "All your words are but to say: you are a woman, and your part is in the house. But... I can ride and wield blade, and I do not fear either pain or death." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Lisa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "In a hole in the ground there lived a hobbit." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Lisa add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "In my younger and more vulnerable years my father gave me some advice that I've been turning over in my mind ever since." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description: "I have been mortal, and some part of me is mortal yet. I am full of tears and hunger and the fear of death, although I cannot weep, and I want nothing, and I cannot die. I am not like the others now, for no unicorn was ever born who could regret, but I do. I regret." -- Peter S. Beagle

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "The pre-Socratic Greek philosopher [author:Parmenides|357208] taught that the only things that are real are things which never change... and the pre-Socratic Greek philosopher [author:Heraclitus|77989] taught that everything changes. If you superimpose their two views, you get this result: Nothing is real." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "My schedule for today lists a six-hour self-accusatory depression." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Lisa add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "The sky above the port was the color of television, tuned to a dead channel." -- William Gibson

item.title: Lisa add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "Cyberspace. A consensual hallucination experienced daily by billions of legitimate operators, in every nation, by children being taught mathematical concepts... A graphic representation of data abstracted from banks of every computer in the human system. Unthinkable complexity. Lines of light ranged in the nonspace of the mind, clusters and constellations of data. Like city lights, receding..." -- William Gibson

item.title: Lisa add a quote by William Gibson
item.description: "It was hot, the night we burned Chrome." -- William Gibson

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Ryan Mecum
item.description: "Blood is really warm, it's like drinking hot chocolate but with more screaming." -- Ryan Mecum

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description: "She will remember your heart when men are fairy tales in books written by rabbits." -- Peter S. Beagle

item.title: Lisa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I don't know half of you half as well as I should like; and I like less than half of you half as well as you deserve." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "We are survival machines – robot vehicles blindly programmed to preserve the selfish molecules known as genes. This is a truth which still fills me with astonishment." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description: "Great heroes need great sorrows and burdens, or half their greatness goes unnoticed. It is all part of the fairy tale." -- Peter S. Beagle

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description: "Never run from anything immortal. It attracts their attention. " -- Peter S. Beagle

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description: "Marveling at his own boldness, he said softly, "I would enter your sleep if I could, and guard you there, and slay the thing that hounds you, as I would if it had the courage to face me in fair daylight. But I cannot come in unless you dream of me." -- Peter S. Beagle

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Peter S. Beagle
item.description:
"Then what is magic for?" Prince Lír demanded wildly. "What use is wizardry if it cannot save a unicorn?" He gripped the magician's shoulder hard, to keep from falling.
Schmedrick did not turn his head. With a touch of sad mockery in his voice, he said, "That's what heroes are for." -- Peter S. Beagle

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The man in black fled across the desert, and the gunslinger followed." -- Stephen King

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Frank Herbert
item.description: "He who controls the spice controls the universe." -- Frank Herbert

item.title: Lisa add a quote by J. R. R. Tolkien
item.description: "Three Rings for the Elven-kings under the sky, Seven for the Dwarf-lords in halls of stone, Nine for Mortal Men, doomed to die, One for the Dark Lord on his dark throne In the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie. One Ring to rule them all, One Ring to find them, One Ring to bring them all and in the darkness bind them. In the Land of Mordor where the Shadows lie." -- J. R. R. Tolkien

item.title: Lisa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "The Road goes ever on and on Down from the door where it began. Now far ahead the Road has gone, And I must follow, if I can, Pursuing it with eager feet, Until it joins some larger way Where many paths and errands meet. And whither then? I cannot say" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Lisa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Never laugh at live dragons, Bilbo you fool!" -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Lisa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "If the elf-king had a weakness it was for treasure, especially for silver and white gems; and though his hoard was rich, he was ever eager for more, since he had not yet as great a treasure as other elf-lords of old." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Lisa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "It does not do to leave a live dragon out of your calculations, if you live near him." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Lisa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Stand by the grey stone when the thrush knocks, and the setting sun with the last light of Durin’s Day will shine upon the key-hole." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Lisa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Truly songs and tales fall utterly short of the reality, O Smaug the Chiefest and greatest of Calamities." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Lisa add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "So comes snow after fire, and even dragons have their endings." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Lisa add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Go then, there are other worlds than these." -- Stephen King
